bioghist.p: Rex Stowers Clements (1902-1981) was a Presbyterian minister and administrator. He was assistant minister of the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church, New York from 1931 to 1932; minister at the Presbyterian Church of the Covenant from 1932 to 1937; Minister of the Bryn Mawr Presbyterian Church from 1937 to 1962; and President of the Board of Christian Education of the Presbyterian Church in the United States of America from 1941 to 1949. He also served as Executive Secretary of the Council on Theological Education of the United Presbyterian Church of the USA.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Rex Stowers Clements. Materials include: church bulletins from Bryn Mawr Presbyterian Church, many with sermons attached (1937-1962); bulletins from the Church of the Covenant (First Presbyterian) in Boston; sermons preached at other churches (1960s-1970s); prayers, including a binder of "Prayers for Special Seasons in the Church Year"; articles written by Clements at Yale University (1927-1929); programs from "Church of the Air" radio sermons preached by Clements (1963); and a small number of materials related to the Council on Theological Education, including minutes and speeches.
